topic.title: KopyKate BIG - Video Sharing with Big Files, the YouTube of Everything
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit
KopyKate BIG - Video Sharing with Big Files, the YouTube of Everything

KopyKate launches its big file experiment. Built upon the ZeroUp code, it features a search engine, video player, editable content and more coming soon!

Unlike ZeroUp, this is for videos only. Up to 2gb allowed. Will be clonable and fully functional by Christmas, and will include documentation.

topic.title: Are Big Files killing ZeroNet Proxies? More options needed.
KopyKate BIG 1.1 ALPHA - Video Sharing Platform for ZeroNet
/r/CryptoUBI - Making Universal Basic Income become a Reality
I Fucking Hate College
Rojava - A Utopia in the Heart of Syria's Chaos
What I think of the world today ...
KopyKate BIG v0.1.15 + To-Do-List for 0.2.0 - 0.3.0 !
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit
 
Right. The holidays officially begin! ;)
 
I just added a file delete option for testing purposes. Simply click on "Seeding: xx mb" and it should ask whether you want to stop seeding the file. It'll then delete the file from your optional files list..
 
I tested it on the proxy, and it prevents you from deleting files on it if you're not the admin, so it's all working fine.
 
I need some feedback as to what kind of functions you'd love to see on the site. 

New short-term To-Do (12/12/2017):

- Enable editing / deleting comments, enable replies.
- Improved general editing interface thumbnail, description, etc.
- Improved file manager look
- Improved left menu look
- Loading screen for video, showing peers .. downloaded %..etc.
- Perfected video scaling for mobile
- Automatically seed a whole channel (i.e. subscribe)

Long term To-Do:

- Enable uploading 240p, 480p ,etc. alternative video files to the same link.. so that playback is faster on mobile. 
- HTML5 video with custom player and buttons
- Upvotes for files and/or comments?
- Improved uploader for ZeroNet Proxy (uploading via proxy is currently disabled, as the proxy currently only has enough space to be a seedbox for files that are lacking in peers. It then automatically deletes files that have tons of peers.)
- (0.3.0) Merger sites featuring video hubs, not unlike ZeroMe
- (0.3.0) Video encoding bot

topic.title: www.zerocat.eu zerocat.eu - Proxy Update
topic.body:
https://www.zerocat.eu/
Following updates were made to the proxy:

- You can now open more than one tab/window. The miner will recognize every other tab/window as a child tab and automatically stop. Should the previous tab/window be closed, then the child tab becomes the main tab and automatically starts the miner!

To-do-list in the short term:

- On mobile devices, automatically stop the miner if battery level is below 25%.
- Use rewrite instead of redirect for subdomain > subfolder server blocks to avoid Cloudflare errors when using https to access said subdomains?

Benefits of using ZeroNet proxies:

- Get instant peers for your new site
- View your site from the perspective of other users, debugging
- Boost availability of your big files until they get enough seeders
- Use ZeroNet without installing ZeroNet, if storage is limited or ZeroNet client cannot be installed, etc.
- Raise awareness of ZeroNet to outsiders

topic.title: Hard Work is Overrated [video]
Does programming change your way of thinking?
Beware of the Binary Options scam
Projects for 2018 (new year's resolutions)
topic.body:
Most of these projects I've kinda already started working on, though admittedly, I'm sometimes guilty of shuffling between unfinished stuff here and then..
 
It's too damn hot right now, too. I don't think I can stand the heat in this bedroom anymore.. it was a blessing during winter time, but in the summer it's a curse. Even my PC fans are going wild. It makes me nauseous and unable to think straight. I'm seriously considering getting out of this house and going to a public library during the daytime, program there instead, since they have air conditioning. Chances are, they'll probably have dreamweaver and stuff like that .. it'll be good to take a break from gedit and notepadqq.. ... as much as I love Linux.
 
Anywhoo.. here's some stuff I'd like to be able to accomplish in the short term:
- **encoder.zerocat.eu** : A free node.js video encoding website/server piped through a Nginx proxy, with some sort of a file storage regulator, so that clients don't DDoS the thing uploading too many files. Let the servers do the dirty work, give my PC another break. No ads, no mining. Gotta have a link to ZeroNet though, and my proxy... talk about movement building. 
- **im.not.as.good.as** : (iNaga) An open source, Actionscript framework that allows you to control animations through simple functions with parameters and options ranging from the very basic, to the more advanced and sophisticated. 

=> Basically, you have an environment full of 2-dimensional AI marionettes and toys, and it's all yours to command. 
=>The characters are structured so as to enable ease of assembly and disassembly, just like 2d lego. 
=> The style is akin to a hybrid between Anime and South Park. 
=> Makes creating cartoons as easy as playing video games. This is suitable for people who feel they have good ideas and a good storyline, but don't want to have to put in the time and effort that is normally involved in animating.. (besides.. spending more time and effort on your videos doesn't necessarily equate to move views and likes, either.... I mean it does, but.... you're still handicapped compared to YouTubers who just do commentary over video game footage and then live off the ad-revenue.. so get those animations pumping and bring story-telling back to the internets..!)
 
- **first-contact** : Dating app that matches you up with people of your preferred gender, who share similar facial characteristics with you ... based on the facial similarity theory of sexual & romatic attraction. Inspired by the Fermi Paradox; there's nowhere in hell that we are alone, we're not that special .. there's gotta be someone just like us, somewhere out there in the universe.. but why the hell won't they visit?

=> Takes advantage of the blockchain in order to reduce server costs. 
=> Respects your privacy.. images aren't stored on the blockchain ..... rather, facial shape coordinates are stored as public keys, and then paired with other public keys in order to create matches. It is then up to both parties to agree to initiate contact.
=> Features real-time Virtual Social Clubs, basically a mmorpg where you get to meet people and mingle and chat. None of that second life bullshit.. has to be grounded in reality, you can't choose how you look like. There's no dragons and night elves with big boobs. No cheating, or bad karma will follow!
=> The clear-net, server-side applications will run cryptocurrency miners in order to reward the creators, and help fund whatever server costs there may be, obviously. If it does make it big, none of it will be spent on mansions or luxury yachts - the money will be pumped straight into cryptocurrency-based Universal Basic Income dividends. Let machines and AI create paradise on Earth so that humans can live free and without having to worry about money, move on to more important matters like the stopping the hypothetical Heat Death of the Universe.. simple.
 
- **In the long term** I'd also like to work on robots, which I've already done, so I mean.. continue working on them. It would be great to have an affordable, open-source personal-helper robot that can follow you around and carry groceries and all that.. and fix your computer. And provide home surveillance. And show you low resolution mid-air videos (femto-second IR lasers). And bring you a beer. And crack it open. And talk to you. Kinda like R2D2. 

=> Uses machine learning. The brain of the robot will consist of various bootstrap 'modules' that keep stacking up with time and automatic updates. For example, the human brain might have 'modules' that handle Love-making, eating, sleeping.. ... curiosity... speech, emotion... visual processing... humor... well, same with the robot. Automatic updates will help the number of modules grow, which helps the robot evolve and gain complexity. You could even create modules that allows the robot to create its own modules.
 
And yeah, it's all gotta be open source. I guess it's my way of paying for all the free movies I've watched and the cracked software i've downloaded. Also, money sucks.. the sooner we can do away with it, the better. People aren't lazy.. they just tend to be more motivated to do shit that they care about.

**UPDATE:**
**- Added new TV show BrainDead. All past episodes are currently being encoded for online streaming. Once it's finished, new episodes will be added as soon as they're released.**
**- Improved seeding of KopyKate torrents thanks to additional software testing.**

1_1PvAednzaMJiuMz1SD5wF3m3Hx7SK75zHv.body:
Hi there ;)
FYI - I've just uploaded my torrents to a seedbox, so they're now available 24/7. Any torrent submitted by Kopyjane or Kopykate will be web-seeded.

A big problem we have is that **people are too lazy to seed..** they just expect others to do all the seeding. And because we can't borrow any peers from BitTorrent clients, we kinda have to start from scratch.

So the solution is to use HTTP web-seeds as a temporary backup, at least until the site goes viral. In fact, every time you stream the videos - you are simultaneously seeding them .. so the more viewers we get, the better.

Site is also available at  http://kopykate.ga/ .. which will Forward the link to a ZeroNet proxy. 

**REGARDING UPLOADING - Because this is not YouTube.com, videos need to be seeded by the user in order to play. Don't close the tab of the Upload page until you've added your magnet link to the Webtorrent Desktop client. Use the x264 and AAC codecs because we can't encode on your behalf, as this is not a webserver.**

**REGARDING WEBRTC - It will not work in Tor browser. It will NOT reveal your IP address IF you are using a VPN. Cheers!**

**And last but not least; The whole purpose of using ZeroNet + WebTorrent magnet links is to maintain a database of torrents that cannot be shut down by authority.**

Enjoy ;)

> [testuser789](#comment_9_1PvAednzaMJiuMz1SD5wF3m3Hx7SK75zHv): OH YEAH ! Oh yeah! OH YEAH, FOLKS ! It works! Now on Kopy Kate OFFICIAL I've managed to do streaming down and uploading videos ! Fucking great. And as always: Once you've managed it, it doesn't appear that hard ;) Here's how I've done upload on Kopy Kate OFFICIAL:
> 
> Using firefox browser - new, private window (before making sure webRTC is on by config:about - media.peerconnection.enable 'true')
> Going on Kopy Kate OFFICIAL - http://127.0.0.1:43110/1aCq7GiJfUfGZ4GftjYaYbsEngPFzcxvN/
> right click on "+ Upload new video!" and open new tab with it
> Under "Upload .mp4 file:" click on "search", look for the video you want to upload and confirm with "ok"
> Type in Title, description, look online fore a nice pic of your video and copy its link and paste it in the respective field, choose the video category
> Left-click, hold, drag & drop the "magnet link" into your WebTorrent.desktop - here's a screenshot how it looks like: https://abload.de/img/kopykateofficialuploa9ekiu.png
> wait until WebTorrent.desktop is done with loading
> Then on the upload page of Kopy Kate OFFICIAL click on the "add video" button
> 
> THAT'S IT !!! SUCCESS !!! You can tell by yourself when you visit Kopy Kate OFFICIAL after the upload, see your video in the list, click on it and then on Kopy Kate OFFICIAL you'll see how your video is being streamed down and has at least 1 peer.
> Ah, and here's the link of my first successful video upload: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1aCq7GiJfUfGZ4GftjYaYbsEngPFzcxvN/?Topic:6_1PvAednzaMJiuMz1SD5wF3m3Hx7SK75zHv/Reclaim+your+freedom+with+free+libre+software+now+Richard+Stallman+of+Free+Software+Movement
> When I find the time for it, I will re-shape my starting posting here to be more like a tutorial...

Your computer must be switched off right now? :p

I'll have to do a tutorial on how to create a Webseed, as well. Of course, it's only a matter of adding ' &ws= ' to the end of your magnet link and then adding a HTTPS:// link to the exact same file that the torrent contains, but stored inside a webserver.. then previewing this magnet link in Instant.io, downloading the resulting .torrent file .. and uploading the torrent file into the same folder as the original .mp4 you have on your webserver. Of course, this can still confuse a lot of people .. 

You can actually use Dropbox to create webseeds. At least, until they fix the exploit which allows you to create direct links by using the dl.dropboxusercontent.com domain. 

I'm using a VPS for my seedbox and it's got about 200GB storage, for $9 a month (6 USD). So .. it could fit about 220 movies.. or 500-700 TV-show episodes. And I'm friends with the owner of the VPS provider.

What I like about it is that I can just go to a friend's house and then just stream the movies I want instead of carrying a USB drive or installing uTorrent on their computer.. so it kinda benefits me as well. :p

> [kaffie](#comment_244_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I've tried a few times now and I can't manage to get webseeded torrents to actually play properly. The only way it ends up working is if I open webtorrent desktop, let the page 'find' the peers, and then close webtorrent desktop and let the page download from the webseed. But of course that defeats the whole point of having them webseeded in the first place.
> Edit: Figured it out. KopyKate auto-filled the magnet link and using the magnet doesn't seem to work, but pasting in the link to the .torrent (like I did originally to load the upload page) allows the video to be webseeded properly. Sweet. Time to upload some videos :3

I'll create a video tutorial soon. :-)

Miners don't actually pay out that much at all. You'd need something like 5000 visitors a day to make a real profit, if you were running it at the throttle that I recommended.

> [phr34kzz](#comment_27_166Kgk6LesoTpoTTWciSHeq98UB4mTUcsf): Lel. Go get a static IP and run it from your home or whatever. I've seen people running it from a raspi cluster. Zeronet is lightweight. Quit the whine woman. The real problem here is blocking access from content and forcing others. How can you call "Internet Freedom" when there's a wall? Get your facts checked

For the record, I never suggested running a miner on a Zite. That would be bad practice..
 
Coinhive should only be used for the clearnet. It doesn't cost money to host zites, but it does cost money to host content on proxies with high speed datacenters, using decent domains, CDN, etc.

Once my ZeroNet proxy takes off with my buddy's vps, I'll be sure to always donate a monthly portion of my mining revenue to the ZeroNet creators (..and if it gets big enough, I'll likely also allocate another portion to help fund cryptocurrency-based Universal Basic Income projects.. then we can all live happily ever after!).

I seriously doubt it will be affected.. unless media corporations really start to consider file-sharing a huge threat to their survival, which they already do.. but not to the extent of actually banning or restricting access to torrent clients. ZeroNet is just a client, you cannot ban access to a client, that would be like banning web-browsers just because they can be used to access p2p sites.

> [herp](#comment_20_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): As of this ZeroNet commit we no longer need a separate "Fullscreen!" button!

Thanks for the news. I knew they'd fix it.. I mean, it seems like a no-brainer, right?

> [styromaniac](#comment_280_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I'd like the top bar to never scroll off screen, and to be completely honest, the red bar looks much better than the white bar. The white bar doesn't show the full logo, reading like "KOPYKATI" and looks too busy anyway. It's kind of weird to see both bars, each on a different screen orientation. [...]

Of course, the problem with having the top menu at position Fixed on mobile devices is that, it takes up a big chunk of space on the screen, especially on really small phones.. so it made sense to give users the freedom to scroll in this scenario.

Tried it, although I'm not sure if its working..

> [krixano](#comment_193_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): What you could do is have something run once upon update that will automatically convert a user's images from their external sources into base64. You could also just do this on your own computer and sign everyone's data.json with the zite's private key. Not sure how hard this is though.

hmm. That sounds a bit forced... 
 
Well. There's only about 400 videos on the site anyway. Better do this early than late. :)

Of course, if one were to implement the YouTube route of automatically retreiving a video frame and using it as thumbnails, then you'd have to have server-side code running. The nature of ZeroNet zites is pretty much 100% client-side. It's what enables the sites to function offline, anyway... unless you have an external plugin/script/code/app running, which I did with the encoder.

> [herp](#comment_28_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe): Can you not simply reference the selected video file on the client's computer, compute the frame from that, convert to base64 and include it in the video posting? Aka do this all client-side?

That could work too I guess. FileReader buffer

Guess I could look into that, too. Once the priority functions have been built

You mean kind of like ZeroMe hubs, as opposed to user channels?

[...]

Never really experimented with merger sites before, though I can figure it out. I'm just scratching my head wondering if this will require a re-write of the entire thing .. lol
 
Now that I think about it, I'm also really glad I used Base64 instead of a folder/file upload. Base64 fits nicely into user/data.json .. and you can edit/delete it as many times as you like without adding/removing any additional files.

1512772714_16PUgFapj8pSnEnS1bcAGVRPtfwvQ.body:
Are you using a domain? Or just your IP?
 
If you are:
`python zeronet.py --ui_port 80 --ui_host www.mydomain.com mydomain.com 127.0.0.1 --ui_ip '*'`
If you aren't (xx means public IP):
`python zeronet.py --ui_port 80 --ui_host xx.xx.xx.xx 127.0.0.1 --ui_ip '*'`
